title: non-defining opaque type use in defining scope
body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried this code on **nightly-2022-10-21**:

```rust
#![feature(type_alias_impl_trait)]

trait Set<D: 'static> {
    type Iter<'t>: Iterator<Item = D> where Self: 't;
    fn iter_discrims(&self) -> Self::Iter<'_>;
}

impl<D: Copy + 'static> Set<D> for Vec<D> {
    type Iter<'t> = impl Iterator<Item = D> where Self: 't;
    fn iter_discrims(&self) -> Self::Iter<'_> { self[..].iter().copied() }
}
```

This should compile because the TAIT should resolve into `Copied<slice::Iter<'t, D>>`.

Instead, I get this error:

```
error: non-defining opaque type use in defining scope
  --> src/lib.rs:10:49
   |
10 |     fn iter_discrims(&self) -> Self::Iter<'_> { self[..].iter().copied() }
   |                                                 ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ lifetime `'_` is part of concrete type but not used in parameter list of the `impl Trait` type alias
```

To prove that this code should compile, I simply change the TAIT to a named type:

```rs
type Iter<'t> = std::iter::Copied<std::slice::Iter<'t, D>>;
```

and this compiled.

I also tested the problematic code on **nightly-2022-10-20** (one day before) and the code compiled correctly, so there is most likely a regression within the rollup that day.
